Gosh, this is the second time I've made a post to a mailing list and
forgotten to include some important detail! That's it, I'm putting a blurb
in my sig file. Anyway, the book is titled:

Java Tools for Extreme Programming: Mastering Open Source Tools, including
Ant, JUnit, and Cactus

and you can buy it at:

http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/ASIN/047120708X/qid=1009468166/sr=8-1/ref=
sr_8_3_1/104-6010699-0942316

Sorry (sheepish grin),

Nick

  -----Original Message-----
  From: Thomas SMETS [mailto:tsmets@...]
  Sent: Saturday, December 22, 2001 3:17 PM
  To: junit@yahoogroups.com; nick@...
  Subject: Re: [junit] Submitting a link to the JUnit page



  Bloody hell, Nicholas     :-))
  Just give the name of the book, will you !  :-))

  You don't have to post the reply on the ML unless too many request it !
  But you could have send some infos to me directly.


  Nothing personnal, heee !
  I just find it funny that you don't mention
  the books title or whatever while request to :-))


  Thomas,




    ----- Original Message -----
    From: Nicholas Lesiecki
    To: junit@yahoogroups.com
    Sent: Thursday, December 20, 2001 5:44 PM
    Subject: RE: [junit] Submitting a link to the JUnit page


    It's actually been released, I just go my copies yesterday.
      -----Original Message-----
      From: Thomas SMETS [mailto:tsmets@...]
      Sent: Thursday, December 20, 2001 8:53 AM
      To: junit@yahoogroups.com
      Subject: Re: [junit] Submitting a link to the JUnit page


      When is the book dued ?
      In what phase is it @ the moment ?
      Thomas,
        ----- Original Message -----
        From: Nicholas Lesiecki
        To: junit@yahoogroups.com
        Sent: Wednesday, December 19, 2001 7:42 PM
        Subject: RE: [junit] Submitting a link to the JUnit page


        Thanks Mike. BTW, good job on JUnitPerf, we've used it a couple of
times. It
        makes good use of the JUnit framework as well as being very
practical. We
        covered it in the book. I think Rick wrote the section.

        Cheers,

        Nick

        -----Original Message-----
        From: Mike Clark [mailto:mike@...]
        Sent: Wednesday, December 19, 2001 11:03 AM
        To: junit@yahoogroups.com
        Subject: Re: [junit] Submitting a link to the JUnit page


        Nicholas Lesiecki wrote:

        > I know the JUnit homepage lists article and links of interest to
users of
        > JUnit, and I was wondering if anyone on the list knew whom I would
submit
        a
        > potential link to.
        >

        Erik Meade dutifully maintains the site.  You can reach him at
        junit@....

        Mike

        --
        Mike Clark
        Clarkware Consulting, Inc.
        http://www.clarkware.com
        720.851.2014
